15   |  **			modules.					     **
16   |  ** 									     **

70   | 
71   | /*++++
72   |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
73   |  ** 									     **
74   |  **   Function:		ModuleCmd_Clear					     **
75   |  ** 									     **
76   |  **   Description:	Execution of the module-command 'clear'		     **
77   |  **			Resets the modules runtime information but doesn't   **
78   |  **			apply further changes to the environment at all      **
79   |  ** 									     **
80   |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
81   |  ** 									     **
82   |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		Attached Tcl Interp. **
83   |  **			int		 argc		Number of arguments  **
84   |  **			char 		*argv[]		Argument list	     **
85   |  ** 									     **
86   |  **   Result:		int	TCL_ERROR	Failure			     **
87   |  **				TCL_OK		Successful operation	     **
88   |  ** 									     **
89   |  **   Attached Globals:							     **
90   |  ** 									     **
91   |  ** ************************************************************************ **
92   |  ++++*/
93   | 
94   | int ModuleCmd_Clear(	Tcl_Interp	*interp,
95   | 		    	int         	 argc,
96   | 		    	char		*argv[])
97   | {
98   |     char		buf[10],	/** user response input **/
99   | 			*ptr,		/** reponse pointer **/
100  |     			*clearargv[4];	/** argv vector **/
101  | 	Tcl_Obj       **objv;		/** Tcl Object vector **/
102  | 	int             objc;		/** Tcl Object vector count **/
103  |     
104  |     /**
105  |      **  Ask the user if he's really sure about what he's doing ...
106  |      **/
107  |     if( argc == 1 && !strcmp( argv[0], "yes")) {
108  | 	buf[0] = 'y';
109  |     } else {
110  | 	fprintf(stderr,
111  |             "\nAre you sure you want to clear all loaded modules!? [n] ");
112  | 	 ptr = fgets(buf, 10, stdin);
113  |     }
114  | 
115  |     /**
116  |      **  Reset the shell variables 'LOADEDMODULES' and '_LMFILES_'
117  |      **/
118  |     if( *ptr == 'y' || *ptr == 'Y') {
119  | 
120  |         clearargv[0] = "setenv";
121  |         clearargv[1] = "LOADEDMODULES";
122  |         clearargv[2] = "";
123  |         clearargv[3] = NULL;
124  | 	/* convert fomr argv to objv */
125  | 	Tcl_ArgvToObjv(&objc, &objv, -1, (char **) clearargv);
126  |         cmdSetEnv( (ClientData) 0, interp, objc, objv);
127  | 
128  |         clearargv[0] = "setenv";
129  |         clearargv[1] = "_LMFILES_";
130  |         clearargv[2] = "";
131  |         clearargv[3] = NULL;
132  | 	/* convert fomr argv to objv */
133  | 	Tcl_ArgvToObjv(&objc, &objv, -1, (char **) clearargv);
134  |         cmdSetEnv( (ClientData) 0, interp, objc, objv);
135  | 
136  |     } else {
137  |         fprintf( stderr, "\nLOADEDMODULES was NOT cleared.\n");
138  |     }
139  |     
140  |     /**
141  |      **  Return on success
142  |      **/
143  | 
144  |     return( TCL_OK);
145  | }
